com.hourglassapps.util

Class AbstractComboExpander<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hourglassapps.util.AbstractComboExpander<I,O>

  • public abstract class AbstractComboExpander<I,O>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractComboExpander(MultiMap<I,java.util.Set<O>,O> pOrig2Expansions, Converter<I,O> pConverter)
      An instance of this class will look up each element of an array in pOrig2Expansions for possible output values and generate all permutations by returning all possible output values for each each input element in turn.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int expand(I[] pTerms)
      Provides an array of input values.
      abstract void onExpansion(java.util.List<O> pExpansions)
      Subclasses will override this method to handle each output permutation.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractComboExpander

        public AbstractComboExpander(MultiMap<I,java.util.Set<O>,O> pOrig2Expansions,
                     Converter<I,O> pConverter)
        An instance of this class will look up each element of an array in pOrig2Expansions for possible output values and generate all permutations by returning all possible output values for each each input element in turn.
        Parameters:
        pOrig2Expansions - A MultiMap listing all possible output values for different input values
        pConverter - Where an input value is not found in pOrig2Expansions this generates an output value. If pConverter is null then if an input value is not found no output values will be generated in response to an invocation of the expand method.

    • Method Detail

      • expand

        public int expand(I[] pTerms)
        Provides an array of input values. In response each element is passed to the MultiMap used to instantiate the class to retrieve a set of output values for that element. All permutations of these output values are then passed to the onExpansion method.
        Parameters:
        pTerms - array of inputs

      • onExpansion

        public abstract void onExpansion(java.util.List<O> pExpansions)
        Subclasses will override this method to handle each output permutation. Each invocation of onExpansion corresponds to one permutation.

        Parameters:
        pExpansions - One permutation of outputs. Each element in pExpansions corresponds to its respective element which was passed to the expand method. So pExpansions.get(3) is one of the values pTerms[3] was mapped to in the pOrig2Expansions constructor argument, assuming that there were at least 3 elements in pTerms.
